intro: Horkelia fusca subsp. capitata, commonly known as the Sierra foothill bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, adapted to reduce water loss in arid environments. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, known for its showy, tubular flowers.
